p: Zika virus (ZIKV) belongs to the Flaviviridae family, which encompasses viruses such as dengue virus, yellow fever virus, West Nile virus, tick-borne encephalitis virus, and Japanese encephalitis virus [ 1]. The ZIKV is a mosquito-borne arbovirus, for which Aedes mosquitoes are competent vectors. The virus is transmitted mainly by Aedes aegypti, known to be active during the morning hours, but other Aedes species, including Aedes albopictus, has also been reported. The Aedes mosquitoes are amongst the invasive species, expanding its geographic range which consequently brings the threat of arboviral infections also to the temperate zones [ 2]. Until now, ZIKV infections have been confirmed in 91 countries in South and Central America, Central Africa, South Asia, the South Pacific region, and Europe [ 3, 4].
